ojc.bain

Class NeuralNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • ojc.bain.NeuralNetwork

  • public class NeuralNetwork
extends java.lang.Object

    The main class for running a neural network simulation. A NeuralNetwork is run at a specified time resolution, which is the number of discrete simulation steps performed for each second of simulation time. A typical resolution is 1000, or 1ms duration for each step.

    A NeuralNetwork consists of a NeuronCollection and a SynapseCollection. These collections of neural network components are designed to be executable on SIMD hardware (eg a GPU) via OpenCL via Aparapi (See ComponentCollection for more details).

    To improve performance, ComponentCollection and extensions thereof use the explicit memory management feature of Aparapi. When using SIMD hardware such as a GPU, the data to be processed must be transferred to the device, and the results transferred back to the CPU after the computations have been performed. These transfers take a significant amount of time. So data is only transferred when necessary (eg if it will be used by another kernel, or if it has been requested).

    If a preferred execution mode is not set (see setPreferredExecutionMode(Kernel.EXECUTION_MODE preferredExecutionMode) ), then for neuron or synapse collections consisting of fewer than minimumSizeForGPU neurons or synapses, use of a CPU-based execution mode is forced as this is typically more performant than use of SIMD hardware; if using a CPU-based execution mode then if the size is greater than or equal to minimumSizeForJTP the JTP execution mode is used, otherwise the SEQ execution mode is used.

    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman

    • Field Detail

      • minimumSizeForGPU

        protected int minimumSizeForGPU
        When automatically selecting an execution mode, this is the minimum number of components in a collection before the GPU execution mode is attempted. Default is 8192.

      • minimumSizeForJTP

        protected int minimumSizeForJTP
        When automatically selecting an execution mode, this is the minimum number of components in a collection before the JTP execution mode is used. Default is Integer.MAX_VALUE (currently disabled, JTP is sloooow, for various reasons).

      • preferredExecutionMode

        protected com.amd.aparapi.Kernel.EXECUTION_MODE preferredExecutionMode
        The preferred execution mode, which will override an automatically selected mode if not null.

      • step

        protected long step

      • timeResolution

        protected int timeResolution

      • stepPeriod

        protected double stepPeriod

      • neurons

        protected NeuronCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> neurons

      • synapses

        protected SynapseCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> synapses

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuralNetwork

        public NeuralNetwork(int timeResolution)
        Create a new simulation.

      • NeuralNetwork

        public NeuralNetwork(int timeResolution,
             NeuronCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> neurons,
             SynapseCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> synapses)
        Create a new neural network. Sets the time resolution of the given neuron and synapse collections to match that of this neural network and resets them.
        Parameters:
        timeResolution - The number of discrete simulation steps performed for each second of simulation time. A typical resolution is 1000, or 1ms duration for each step.
        neurons - The NeuronCollection to use in the network.
        synapses - TheSynapseCollection to use in the network.

      • NeuralNetwork

        public NeuralNetwork(int timeResolution,
             NeuronCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> neurons,
             SynapseCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> synapses,
             com.amd.aparapi.Kernel.EXECUTION_MODE preferredExecutionMode)
        Create a new neural network. Sets the time resolution of the given neuron and synapse collections to match that of this network and resets them. Allows specifying the preferred execution mode, which will override the automatic selection of a mode based on network size.
        Parameters:
        timeResolution - The number of discrete simulation steps performed for each second of simulation time. A typical resolution is 1000, or 1ms duration for each step.
        neurons - The NeuronCollection to use in the network.
        synapses - TheSynapseCollection to use in the network.
        preferredExecutionMode - The preferred execution mode, which will override the automatic selection of a mode based on network size.

        Set the preferred execution mode, which will override an automatically selected mode if not null. Set to null to enable automatic mode selection.

        Reinitialises the simulation. This is generally only for internal use.

        public double getStepPeriod()
        Get the duration in seconds of each simulation step.

      • step

        public void step()
        Simulate one time step.

      • run

        public void run(int steps)
        Run the simulation for the given number of steps. This should be used in preference to using a loop of a fixed number of iterations that only calls step() as it allows for more efficient use of OpenCL execution by avoiding unnecessary buffer transfers between each step.

      • getStep

        public long getStep()
        Returns the current simulation step number.

      • getTime

        public double getTime()
        Returns the current simulation time in seconds.

      • getNeurons

        public NeuronCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> getNeurons()
        Returns the neurons in this network.
        Returns:
        The NeuronCollection belonging to this network.

      • setNeurons

        public void setNeurons(NeuronCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> neurons)
        Sets the neurons in this network. This will reinitialise and reset the simulation.

      • getSynapses

        public SynapseCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> getSynapses()
        Returns the synapses in this network.
        Returns:
        The SynapseCollection belonging to this network.

      • setSynapses

        public void setSynapses(SynapseCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> synapses)
        Sets the synapses in this network. This will reinitialise and reset the simulation.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
